title: Omnigeneity
summary: Omnigeneity (sometimes also called omnigenity) is a property of a magnetic field inside a magnetic confinement fusion reactor. Such a magnetic field is called omnigenous if the path a single particle takes does not drift radially inwards or outwards on average.[1] A particle is then confined to stay on a flux surface. All tokamaks are exactly omnigenous by virtue of their axisymmetry,[2] and conversely an unoptimized stellarator is generally not omnigenous.
